document.title: SP290-A-European Hornets Tapping at Your Window at Night

author.organization: The University of Tennessee Agricultural Extension Service

document.abstract: If you've seen hornets attracted to lights at night, most likely it is the European hornet, Vespa crabro. This species can be quite intimidating as they buzz and beat against lighted windows at night. They are very defensive, so be sure to maintain a safe distance between you and the hornet.
document.publication-title: Insects, Pests, Plant Diseases and Weeds
